alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Greene; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 4:31AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Ulster and south central Greene Counties through 515 AM EDT... At 431 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Willowemoc to near Ellenville. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Ellenville and Napanoch around 440 AM EDT. Kerhonkson around 445 AM EDT. Woodland Valley Campground and West Shokan around 500 AM EDT. Phoenicia, High Falls, Mount Tremper and Olivebridge around 505 AM EDT. Lanesville, Tillson and Kenneth L Wilson Campground around 510 AM EDT. Kingston, Hurley, Port Ewen and West Hurley around 515 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Cherrytown, Rolling Meadows, Rosendale, Maple Hill, Glenford, Palentown, Atwood, Oliverea, Pacama and Brodhead. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Ulster; Western Greene; Western Ulster
